授業目的:
The purpose of this
course is to introduce 1st year students to the origins and historical
development of Christianity, its presence in the world today, the Bible, and
some Christian theology and language and expressions of Christian faith. Students will also learn about Christianity's influence on societies and social justice movements past and
present and be exposed to the spirit and ideals for establishing Kwansei Gakuin
and its history. Kwansei Gakuin University is a Christian university, founded
in 1889 by Rev. Walter Russell Lambuth, a missionary of the Southern Methodist
Episcopal Church in the United States. Ever since its founding, Kwansei Gakuin
University has educated its students based on the principles of Christianity.
The Christiantiy A&B introductory courses have been important parts of our
education.
到達目標:
1.    to become knowledgeable
about the origin and historical development of Christianity;2.    to become knowledgeable about some Christian foundations – beliefs, practices, values and ethics;3.    to become knowledgeable about Christianity’s
presence and influence in today’s world and some
ministries;4.    to become knowledgeable about the spirit and ideals of Kwansei Gakuin
for student life present and in the future.
授業方法:
In-person lectures,
readings, writings, discussions, and presentations, with two guest speakers
(Zoom or in-person)

第1回: Week 1: Introduction – Course overview, purpose, and class expectations; sharing of one another’s cultural and religious backgrounds; exploring some basics. (In-class written assignment #1 – to hand in at the end of class)
第2回: Week 2: Easter and the origins of Christianity - Jesus of Nazareth (short quiz #1)
Please check Luna for assigned readings in April.
第3回: Week 3: Christianity from its roots: Judaism and the Hebrew Bible / Old Testament
Please check Luna for assigned readings in April.
第4回: Week 4: The Christian Bible and the four gospels (In-class assignment #2 – by group)
Readings for class will be assigned in April.
第5回: Week 5: Christian teachings: Focus on Jesus’ parables (In-class assignment #3)
Readings for class will be assigned in May.
第6回: Week 6: Christian Creeds and Beliefs; Kwansei Gakuin history and values (short quiz #2)
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第7回: Week 7: KGU Uegahara Chapel tour (In-class assignment #5)
第8回: Week 8: Early church formation – Paul’s travels and letters, plus more
Reading for class will be assigned in May.
第9回: Week 9: The Middle Ages and the Renaissance c500-1500 (short quiz #3)
Reading for class will be assigned in June.
第10回: Week 10: The Reformation c1500 – 1650 and into the Modern era c1650-1914
Reading for class will be assigned in June.
第11回: Week 11: Christianity in the 20th and 21st century – 1914 to present and the “missional church” (short quiz #4)
Reading for class will be assigned in June.
第12回:
Week 12: Christianity – Canadian and North American contexts, with guest lecturer: Indigenous leadership (virtual): Rev. Mary Fontaine, Director of Hummingbird Ministries, Presbytery of Westminster, the Presbyterian Church in Canada* (Review & Reflection #1)

*date may change due to speaker availability
If there are any requests from the speaker before hand, students will be notified of the details.
第13回:
Week 13: Christianity – Canadian and North American contexts, with guest lecturer: Intercultural leadership (virtual): Rev. Hyuk Cho, Associate Professor and Director of United Church Faith Formation and Studies, Vancouver School of Theology, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada* (Review & Reflection #2)

*date may change due to speaker availability
If there are any requests from the speaker before hand, students will be notified of the details.
第14回: Week 14: In-class presentations and/or essay submissions, concluding remarks, and  evaluation
